text: hi everyone I am here today I will be
making ba beer is the lesser-known
version of the famous Vietnamese fresh
spring rolls whoa cool it's very popular
strict snack in southern Vietnam even
though the world ma means beef
there's no beef in this recipe the name
our beer is actually derived from a
Chinese dish called OPM but in the
Chinese opium they use the wrapper make
from wood flour
whereas in our Vietnamese version we can
use rice paper and the fillings we're
going to have Chinese sausages fry
omelette strips
jicama and rice twins and also some
fresh fruits so let's get started
firstly in a pan roast the small brush
rims
without any oil by stirring constantly
on medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes until
fragrant then clean the pan fill half
full with water and bring to a boil cook
the Chinese sausages for about a minute
to remove some of the fat and soften
rings well let cool and slightingly on a
diagonal after boiling the sausage
slices should look quite translucent
crack two eggs in a small bowl and beat
until fluffy can you do this with just
sticks if not then just use a fork then
season lightly with a pinch of salt and
a pinch of sugar in a non-stick pan add
in a teaspoon of vegetable oil when it's
hot enough pouring half of the egg
mixture quickly till the pan in a
circular motion to spread the acting Li
and evenly try to make the egg crepe
acting as possible if you have a smaller
pan maybe you can do in three to four
batches when once that is cooked flip it
over and pry the other side for five
more seconds repeat until you finish the
egg mixture let cone and roll them up
slide into half inch strips for this
recipe you will need a special root
vegetable called jicama also known as
Mexican yam you can buy a fresh or
frozen like this in the Asian store mine
was already shredded into strips which
is perfect if you buy fresh one just
peel enter into this size now in a
saucepan heat up some cooking oil and
fry a paper
spoon of minced garlic until fragrant
then add in the victim a strips and stir
fry for about 10 to 15 minutes with some
salt you can also close the lid to
sharpen the cooking time the jicama is
cooked when it's done quite translucent
and paste cut a sweet that's all for the
preparation let's get rolling now on the
rolling station I have letters which I
have tear into smaller pieces
some sweet Asian Basil's the Chinese
sausage cheese slices the stir-fried
comma the roasted dried mushrooms the
eggs some crushed peanuts and fried
shallot of course you also need to make
the sauce and some pickle carrot and
daikon we're going to use rice paper as
the wrapper you can buy these as the
Asian store to soften the rice paper
quickly dip it into a bowl of warm water
you should do this really quick and then
shut off the excess water lay out on a
plate and it will get softer in a few
seconds place a piece of lettuce and a
few basil leaves at one end then
continue with the rest of the fillings
some of the stir-fry jicama a few slices
of Chinese sausages a few yellow on
black strips some roasted mushrooms some
fried shallots and crushed peanuts
live up the rice paper from the end with
vegetables roll one to two rounds first
until you reach the center of the rice
paper then throw both sides
inward and continue rolling until the
end you want to roll it gently but tight
enough so that the ingredients do not
fall out after your first bite a nice
roll should show up all the colors of
the ingredients inside it might take
some practice to have the perfect roll
but I'm sure you can do it to get the
recipes for the sauce and the pickles
just click on them to self transfer the
sauce into a condiment bowl top up with
some fresh chopped chilli and some
carrot daikon pickles to serve this
desolate row in the dipping sauce or
spoon some of the sauce onto the roll
and have a bite it's super fresh super
tasty and a great contrast of color and
texture and the sauce is really the bomb
it ties all the ingredients together so
well you should definitely give it a try
let me know how it turns out and thank
you for watching bye
